PRV does not encode a viral phosphatase, suggesting that a cellular phosphatase may be recruited or induced by PRV to induce dephosphorylation of eIF2. both protein phosphatase 1 (PP1) and protein phosphatase 2 (PP2A) have been reported to dephosphorylate eIF2 (12) IE180 increases expression levels of PP1 or its regulatory complex partner GADD34, thereby promoting dephosphorylation of eIF2. neither PRV infection nor IE180 transfection affected PP1, PP2A or GADD34 protein levels. d-transfected (B) or mock-infected (D) cells represent data from IE180-transfected (B) or PRV-infected (D) cells. we found that an N-terminally His-tagged version of IE180 lost its ability to suppress phosphorylation of eIF2. these findings indicate that IE180 does not alter the protein expression levels of PP1 or GADD34 to initiate dephosphorylation of eIF2. IE63-mediated dephosphorylation of eIF2 is unknown. the only immediate-early protein encoded by PRV, IE180, interferes with phosphorylation of eIF2. IE180 acts as a transcriptional transactivator to control the expression of different genes. IE180 did not affect protein expression levels of either PP1 or its regulatory complex partner GADD34. we found that an N-terminally His-tagged version of IE180 that retains transcriptional transactivating activity lost its ability to suppress phosphorylation of eIF2. this may point toward an interaction of IE180 with components that mediate PP1-dependent dephosphorylation of eIF2.
